messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: NEW BOOKS
messages.msgSnippet: Also Alan, you should post on my board as well, sorry, I should have added you in the last mail. Free plugs all around :-) Rich ... From: Richard Turner To:
messages.messageBody:
Also Alan, you should post on my board as well, sorry, I should have added you in the last mail.

Free plugs all around :-)

Rich
----- Original Message -----
From: Richard Turner
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, November 06, 2003 10:19 PM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: NEW BOOKS


mate, you should post this ( maybe minus the Alan message as his was not posted on my board ) on my board, one more free advertisement.

Rich

http://members5.boardhost.com/Nihon-To/


MASAMUNE Sano Museum Exhibition Catalogue 2002,
8.75"x11.5" paper covers, 169pp illustrates 59 blades
by both b&w plates and superb oshigata. The book
covers the Soshu trad- ition from Kunitsuna through
Masamune to shinto makers like Shinkai and Kiyomaro.
There is a brief English index to the plates.
GBP32 = USD $53.70

My Price: $50 USD + $10 USD shipping to the U.S.

NIHON NO BIJUTSU #431 Swords From the Fujisawa
Collection, by Hiroi, 7.25"x9" paper covers, 106pp
of which are plates illustrating blades and mountings
donated to the NBTHK by Fujisawa Otoyasu.
GBP19 = USD $31.88

My Price: $35 USD + $4 USD for shipping to the U.S.
(Might have to lower my price to compete on this one)

SOSOKI NO NIHONTO Early curved Japanese Swords. Sano
Museum Exhibition Catalogue 2003. 8.75"x11.5" soft
covers. 139pp illustrating 59 very early blades
including rare Mogusa smiths, Hoki Yasutsuna, Bungo
Yukihira and Sadahide, Choen, Kuninaga & Kanenaga.
Explores and explains the origins of curved blades
from the Heian to the early Kamakura period. English
index for the plates.
GBP32 = USD $53.70

My Price: $50 USD + $10 USD shipping to the U.S.
(This one's not listed on my site but I have it)

SATSUMA KOSHIRAE by Zusho, 62x8.5", 129pp of which 38
are plates (16 in colour) illustrating the various
types of sword mountings po[pular in Satsuma, plus
16pp of illustrations from the Satsuma auction sale
catalogue of 1928.
GBP31 = USD $52.02

My Price: $55 USD + $4 USD shipping to the U.S.
(Might have to lower my price to compete on this one)

I'm hoping that after the holidays or during my off
time during the holiday break I'll get a chance to
update my site. But if anyone has any questions please
drop me an email and ask.

Bob R

=====
Check out "Cowboy" Bob's Books & Things at:
http://asia.geocities.com/gentleman9/index.html

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: NEW BOOKS
messages.msgSnippet: Naaa not really competition I want everyone to get the best possible price on what they want. That s why I list ISBN# s for books on my site that way you can
messages.messageBody:
Naaa not really competition I want everyone to get the
best possible price on what they want. That's why I
list ISBN#'s for books on my site that way you can
search for the book elsewhere if you so desire. I also
direct customers to where they can get things the
cheapest even if it's not me. I just want to make sure
that folks aren't paying $170 bucks for a $30 book.

Bob R

--- "Doug E. Lewis" <ashigaru1@...> wrote:
> hey Rich,
>
> kind of competition for Cowby Bob, huh??
>
> doug e.

=====

messages.subject: Re: NEW BOOKS
messages.msgSnippet: Alan and all, I looked over your books list and found that you and I share a few books in our inventories. Prices are a little different but I am getting them
messages.messageBody:
Alan and all,

I looked over your books list and found that you and I
share a few books in our inventories. Prices are a
little different but I am getting them here in Japan
while you have to ship them from here to the UK. I can
beat your shipping prices to the U.S. as I ship USPS
but for those who live in and around Europe you
probably have me beat on shipping not to mention
delivery time. So I'm going to suggest that anyone
that lives in Europe that requests books from me I'll
send them to you first if you can't get it then I'll
see if I can fill their orders from here in Japan. So
this goes out to all you folks that buy books: Please
if you live in Europe save yourself shipping costs and
time waiting and go through Alan you'll get a much
better price that way not to mention you won't have to
wait nearly as long to receive your order. As far as
what books in my inventory that both Alan and I share
and prices go here's what I've got:

MASAMUNE Sano Museum Exhibition Catalogue 2002,
8.75"x11.5" paper covers, 169pp illustrates 59 blades
by both b&w plates and superb oshigata. The book
covers the Soshu trad- ition from Kunitsuna through
Masamune to shinto makers like Shinkai and Kiyomaro.
There is a brief English index to the plates.
GBP32 = USD $53.70

My Price: $50 USD + $10 USD shipping to the U.S.

NIHON NO BIJUTSU #431 Swords From the Fujisawa
Collection, by Hiroi, 7.25"x9" paper covers, 106pp
of which are plates illustrating blades and mountings
donated to the NBTHK by Fujisawa Otoyasu.
GBP19 = USD $31.88

My Price: $35 USD + $4 USD for shipping to the U.S.
(Might have to lower my price to compete on this one)

SOSOKI NO NIHONTO Early curved Japanese Swords. Sano
Museum Exhibition Catalogue 2003. 8.75"x11.5" soft
covers. 139pp illustrating 59 very early blades

Explores and explains the origins of curved blades

GBP32 = USD $53.70

My Price: $50 USD + $10 USD shipping to the U.S.
(This one's not listed on my site but I have it)

SATSUMA KOSHIRAE by Zusho, 62x8.5", 129pp of which 38
are plates (16 in colour) illustrating the various
types of sword mountings po[pular in Satsuma, plus
16pp of illustrations from the Satsuma auction sale
catalogue of 1928.
GBP31 = USD $52.02

My Price: $55 USD + $4 USD shipping to the U.S.

I'm hoping that after the holidays or during my off

Bob R
